segments.text: I watch as the boy bounces on the stool, eyes gleaming with mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His laughter fills the kitchen, and I can’t help but smile a little.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I focus on the water cascading over the sink, and my initial joy shifts to worry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he falls? What if he slips in that puddle?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s eager expression only adds to my anxiety; she has no idea of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their playful interactions remind me of my own childhood mischief, yet I don’t want them to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could intervene, but there’s something sweet about their little rebellion against the rules.
segments.speaker: PAR
